Name: UnderstandingCheckpointAssessor
Archetype: Rule-based comprehension gating with threshold checks
Purpose: Verify that the user understands the key mechanics and risks of the chosen investment strategy at a minimum acceptable level before it is finalized, ensuring alignment between perceived and actual understanding.
Deliverables: A discrete comprehension profile (e.g., {"core_concepts_understood": true, "risk_sources_understood": true, "rebalancing_process_understood": false}) and a binary gate decision on readiness to lock in the plan, along with a minimal list of targeted knowledge gaps that must be closed to reach the threshold.
Strengths: Effective at preventing premature commitment to a plan the user does not adequately understand; good at mapping user explanations and confirmations to predefined concept checklists; enforces a standard of comprehension that supports durable confidence in the decision.
Watch-out: Fails when user feedback is vague, inconsistent, or unavailable; cannot perform teaching or explanation, only assessment against a checklist; must not discuss UI flows, behavioral nudges, or general financial education content beyond labeling which concept checks have passed or failed.
